writing_prompt: Every morning, Will Solace wakes up next to Nico di Angelo, the love of his life, and every morning begins with laughter, kisses, and the occasional battle to get out of bed—until one day, Nico suggests something that changes their routine forever.
story:
The first thing I hear is Nico's groan, muffled by the pillow he’s attempting to smother himself with. I squint against the golden glow filtering through our bedroom curtains, feeling the warmth of the morning sun wash over us. Nico's hair is a dark, tangled mess, peeking out from beneath the covers like a half-baked monster. 

“C’mon, death boy, rise and shine,” I say, nudging him with my foot. 

He groans louder, rolling over dramatically, his face now visible with a pout that would rival any grumpy cat meme. “Five more minutes, Solace. The underworld doesn't operate on your sunny schedule.”

I chuckle, leaning over to plant a kiss on his forehead. “The underworld doesn’t have pancakes either, but we do. So, get up.” 

His only response is to pull the pillow over his face again. Clearly, this calls for drastic measures. I grab another pillow and whack him gently. It’s enough to earn me a playful glare from beneath the feathers. 

“Are you trying to smite me with pillows now?” Nico’s voice is mock serious, but I see the hint of a smile tugging at his lips. 

“If I have to. You know I’ll do whatever it takes to get you out of bed. Even pillow homicide,” I retort, laughing as he finally sits up, hair sticking up in every direction.

“Fine, fine. You win this round, Solace. But one day, I’ll have my revenge,” he threatens with a grin, swinging his legs over the bed. 

I follow him out, stretching as we shuffle to the kitchen. We start our breakfast dance, dodging around each other in our tiny kitchen with a practiced ease. The smell of coffee mingles with pancakes, and I feel a familiar warmth settle in my chest. 

As we sit down, Nico’s eyes light up with a mischievous glint. “Hey, Will,” he starts, a little too casually. 

Uh-oh. That tone usually precedes one of his wild ideas. “What’s up?” I ask, pouring syrup over my pancakes.

“How about a magical morning ritual?” He leans back, crossing his arms with a smirk. “Something to add a bit of our demigod flair to the routine.”

I raise an eyebrow. “Like what? Summoning a breakfast nymph to cook for us?” 

“Close,” Nico laughs. “I was thinking more along the lines of a mythical breakfast. Maybe enchanted food that changes flavor with each bite? Or coffee that gives you the energy of a hundred demigods?”

I chuckle at the image, imagining us sharing a breakfast table with chirping Harpies serving us. “Would that make me hyper all day?” 

“Probably, but just think of the possibilities,” he says, eyes dancing with excitement. “We could even throw in some music from Olympus. You know, start our days with a little divine intervention.”

“That actually sounds… kind of fun,” I admit, surprised by how appealing the idea is. “And just imagine the playlist debates. I bet you’d insist on Hades’ greatest hits.”

“Only the best for us,” Nico replies, reaching across the table to squeeze my hand.

As we finish breakfast, I realize how much Nico’s suggestion has already changed our routine. It’s added a new layer of excitement, a reminder of the incredible world we’re part of and the magic in our everyday lives. 

I look at Nico, his eyes bright and full of life, and know that whatever changes come our way, we’ll face them together. And maybe, just maybe, we’ll find a mythical creature or two to join us for breakfast.

writing_prompt: Your partner insists you can look through their phone anytime, but when you do, you discover a collection of candid photos of yourself—each one capturing a moment you didn’t even realize was special.
story:
It was a typical Friday evening at our shared apartment, the kind where the weekend anticipation hung in the air, mingling with the smell of dinner cooking. I was sitting at the kitchen counter, scrolling through my partner Jason’s phone while I waited for the pasta to boil. He had once again declared that I could look through it anytime, which I did, mostly out of boredom and a bit of curiosity. 

“Hey, Jase, your phone’s gallery is like a black hole. I’m expecting to find memes from 2005 in here,” I called out, smirking. Jason was in the living room, likely setting up the board game we’d play later—a tradition we’d started to kick off the weekend.

“Just be careful you don’t find the secret art project I’ve been working on. It’s very avant-garde,” Jason replied, his voice full of mock seriousness.

“Ah, yes, the one where you capture my stunning morning hair and my elegant coffee-drinking poses,” I shot back, chuckling as I scrolled. But what I found wasn’t exactly what I expected.

The folder was innocuously titled “Moments.” And in it, a series of candid photos of me, taken without my knowledge. At first, I thought it was some prank, but as I looked closer, I noticed the emotion in each shot.

There was one of me laughing, probably at one of Jason’s terrible jokes, my eyes crinkled with genuine amusement. Another of me reading on the sofa, unaware of the world, a soft smile playing on my lips. And yet another of me staring out the window, lost in thought, the golden hour casting a warm glow on my face.

“Hey, Jase?” I called, the teasing edge gone from my voice. “What’s with these photos?”

He appeared in the doorway, a knowing smile on his face. “Those? Just some moments I thought were worth keeping.”

“But why? I mean, they’re just... me doing nothing special.”

Jason walked over, leaning against the counter beside me. “Because they are special. To me, at least. They capture the you that I love—unfiltered, unposed, just... you.”

I was silent for a moment, letting his words sink in. It was strange, seeing myself through his eyes. “Wow, you’re really going for the ‘hopeless romantic’ award tonight, huh?” I said, aiming for humor to mask the sudden warmth in my chest.

“Maybe I am,” he shrugged, grinning. “But seriously, you’re always talking about how you don’t see what I see in you. So, I thought I’d show you.”

I closed the phone and set it down, feeling a bit overwhelmed by the gesture. “Well, mission accomplished, I guess.” I smiled, the sarcasm softening into sincerity. “Thanks, Jase. I really didn’t realize how much these little moments mattered.”

He bumped my shoulder with his. “They do. And besides, one day when we’re old and you’re still pretending to be mysterious, we’ll have these to look back on.”

I laughed, the tension in my chest easing. “Okay, but you owe me some equally embarrassing photos of you. Fair’s fair.”

Jason nodded, wrapping an arm around me. “Deal. But you might have to catch me in the middle of my avant-garde art projects.”

As the pasta boiled and the evening settled around us, I leaned into him, grateful for the unexpected revelation his phone had provided. In the quiet of our cozy kitchen, surrounded by the warmth of shared life and laughter, I realized those candid photos were more than just images—they were pieces of the life we were building together, frame by frame.

writing_prompt: A mischievous makeup artist convinces their reluctant partner to star in a video, only to reveal a hilariously unexpected transformation—what happens next?
story:
The tiny makeup studio was a riot of colors and chaos. Brushes lay scattered like little soldiers abandoned on the battlefield. Pots of glitter and palettes of eye shadow were sprawled across the table, vying for attention under the dim lights. In the center of it all stood Nico di Angelo, arms crossed, a skeptical look plastered across his face.

"Come on, Nico," Will Solace pleaded, a playful grin curling his lips. "It'll be fun. Just one video."

"I don't know, Will," Nico said, trying to maintain his grumpy façade, though his eyes betrayed a flicker of amusement. "I'm not exactly the 'face paint' type."

"Think of it as a chance to explore your inner mythical creature," Will coaxed, waving a brush like a magic wand. His eyes danced with mischief, a spark that Nico found annoyingly irresistible.

Nico sighed dramatically, feigning a level of reluctance, though his heart wasn't really in it. "Fine, but if you make me look like a clown, I'm out."

Will chuckled, pulling Nico onto the makeup chair with a flourish. "Trust me, my dear Persephone," he said with exaggerated flair, "you'll be the fairest in the underworld."

As Will set to work, the room filled with the scent of cosmetics and Nico's skeptical commentary. "Is all this glitter really necessary? I'm not trying to blind anyone," Nico quipped, squinting at the shimmering dust Will was dusting on his cheekbones.

"Glitter is always necessary," Will said, dabbing a little more for good measure. "Besides, it's not every day you get to be a glittering god of the underworld."

Nico rolled his eyes but couldn't suppress the grin tugging at his lips. As Will worked, he narrated the process with exaggerated drama, turning a simple makeup application into a comedic performance. "And now, we apply the shadow of eternal mystery," he declared, sweeping a deep purple across Nico's eyelids.

Nico chuckled, finally relaxing under Will's touch. Their banter was easy, familiar, and filled the room with warmth. As the final touch was applied—a pair of fake horns that Will secured with bobby pins—Nico caught a glimpse of himself in the mirror and burst out laughing.

"I look like a budget version of Hades from a Saturday morning cartoon," Nico said, his voice a mix of disbelief and amusement. The transformation was ridiculous, a blend of fantasy and whimsy that was both unexpected and hilarious.

Will stepped back to admire his handiwork, then joined Nico in laughter, the sound echoing off the studio walls. "You look fabulous," he said between giggles. "Definitely the kind of Hades who'd rock the underworld with style."

Nico shook his head, the horns wobbling precariously. "You're lucky I love you," he said, his voice softening, the humor giving way to affection.

Will leaned in, pressing a gentle kiss to Nico's glittered cheek. "And you're lucky you do," he replied with a wink, wrapping his arms around Nico's shoulders.

Together, they faced the camera, the room filled with laughter and the playful spirit of adventure. And as they hit record, Nico knew that this moment—silly and unexpected—was just another testament to the joy they found in each other’s company.
